enterprise.translation[0].definitions[0]: state/public enterprise especially British English (=one owned by the government)
commercial enterprises such as banks and food manufacturers
enterprise.translation[0].definitions[1]: the activity of starting and running businesses
the management of state enterprise  (=done by the government)
enterprise.translation[0].definitions[2]: a large and complicated project, especially one that is done with a group of other people
The programme is a joint enterprise with the London Business School.
enterprise.translation[0].definitions[3]: the ability to think of new activities or ideas and make them work
Weâ€™re looking for young people with enterprise and creativity.
enterprise.translation[0].note_box[0].se: The company has grown into a large-scale enterprise that employs hundreds of people.
The tax will affect owners of small-scale enterprises consisting of up to ten people.
She is the owner of an extremely successful enterprise.
If you are setting up your own business enterprise, your bank can help.
It's an economic enterprise, not a charity.
New Zealand Rail is a state-owned enterprise.
Many firms relocate to enterprise zones because of tax incentives.
An enterprise economy can generate wealth and reduce unemployment.
enterprise.translation[1].definitions[0]: Good financial accounts are vital to any enterprise.
The company started as a family enterprise.
enterprise.translation[1].definitions[1]: The two companies plan to establish an enterprise to provide computer services to the telecommunications industry.
enterprise.translation[1].definitions[2]: business activity considered as a whole, especially in relation to other parts of the economy, society etc
economic programmes between government and enterprise
enterprise.translation[1].definitions[3]: the ability to think of new activities and ideas and to take risks in business, especially by starting and running new businesses
Managers seemed to lack enterprise and initiative.
an enterprise culture (=an environment in which enterprise is encouraged)
